title: News: Dog is Dead announce new single – ‘Two Devils'
body:
Having received it’s recent premiere on **Huw Stephens**‘ BBC Radio 1 show, **Dog is Dead** have announced that ‘**Two Devils**‘ will be their next single.

Out on March 5th through **Atlantic Records**, the track was produced by **David Kosten**, who has now developed close working relationship with the band. Lead vocalist **Rob Milton** describes the track as _‘Two Devils’ is a tale of guilt and insanity stemming from a twisted relationship in which a girl falls sick. It’s a little dark.‘_ This shift into a more dark and sinister region of the band’s creative output marks a development from the more twee, yet equally as brilliant, days of ‘**Young**‘ and ‘**Hands Down**‘.

With a full UK headline tour announced (dates of which you can find below), 2012 should continue to excite existing fans of **Dog is Dead**, and all of those who are yet to discover this fantastic Nottingham quintet.

**Full Dates:**

February 7 – London Garage (supporting King Charles as part of HMV Next Big Thing)  
February 17 – The Electric Ballroom (supporting Cloud Control)  
February 18 – Norwich Arts Centre  
February 19 – Oxford Academy 2  
February 20 – Birmingham Academy 3  
February 21 – Bristol Thekla  
February 23 – Leicester Academy 2  
February 24 – Stoke Sugarmill  
February 25 – Hull Fruit  
February 26 – Leeds Cockpit  
February 27 – Newcastle Riverside  
February 29 – Aberdeen Café Drummonds  
March 1 – Inverness Hootenanays  
March 2 – Ullapool The Arch  
March 3 – Stornoway The Woodlands Centre  
March 4 – Aviemore Old Bridge Inn  
March 6 – Glasgow King Tuts  
March 7 – Edinburgh Electric Circus  
March 8 – Belfast Auntie Annies  
March 9 – Dublin Academy 2  
March 10 – Lancaster Library  
March 11 – Sheffield Plug  
March 13 – Manchester Deaf Institute  
March 14 – Brighton Komedia  
March 15 – London Borderline  
March 16 – Southampton Joiners  
March 17 – Cardiff Arts Institute
